intro: Kirganelia multiflora var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth kirganelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually smooth and glabrous. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
